intro: Asplundia pastazana, commonly known as the Pastaza arrowroot, is a herbaceous plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Araceae family and is characterized by its arrow-shaped leaves and striking inflorescence. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in montane forests. Its rhizomes are used in traditional medicine and as a source of starch. Asplundia pastazana plays a role in the ecological balance of its native habitat, supporting local biodiversity.
